greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows in which row n lists the k=A000005(n) divisors of n in decreasing order, followed by the lists of their absolute differences up to order k-1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..350, flattened
example: The terms of each row can form a regular triangle, for example row 10:
mathematica: row[n_] := (dd = Divisors[n]; Table[Differences[dd, k] // Reverse // Abs, {k, 0, Length[dd]-1}]); Table[row[n], {n, 1, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 18 2016 *)
xref: Row n has length A184389(n) = A000217(A000005(n)). Row sums give A187215. Last terms of rows give A187203. Columns 1,2 give: A000027, A032742.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 02 2011
